Game.Name: NFL '95 (USA, Europe)
Game.plot: This was the Sega Sports answer to the growing Madden series. The game feature the 1994 rosters and Joe Montana on the cover of the game. It was available for both the Sega Genesis and Sega GameGear.An interesting note, there is no commentary in the game, but there is the occasional line of dialogue from a PA Announcer. Players would hear the occasional "TOUCHDOWN!" It's also key to mention that even though the game featured rosters from 1994, you had the option to start a season with the '93 and '92 rosters as well.NFL 95 also featured classic teams as well as "all star teams" based on regions of the country.The game featured Free Agency, Create-A-Player (which allowed players to create a 21-year-old rookie and adjust his vital statistic.Cheat: Easy Field Goal BlockWhen your opponent attempts a field goal, run your controlled player into the goal post. This will make the kicker not kick the ball, and the play will keep going until you get a sack.
Game.Notes: This video game is similar to the previous, NFL Football '94 Starring Joe Montana, except in this version, there is no play by play commentary, the lineups of the football teams are updated to reflect the 1994 NFL season, and there are more plays for the player's football team to perform on offense and defense. Once again, Joe Montana appears on the title screen.
